title: Utica Comets fall in OT in France
text: Utica Comets fall in OT in France Comets fall 2-1 in overtime to Syracuse in Lyon, France Comment Posted Oct. 2, 2015 at 6:03 PM By Observer-Dispatch Posted Oct. 2, 2015 at 6:03 PM Tony DeAngelo scored early in overtime and the Syracuse Crunch topped the Utica Comets 2-1 in a preseason game Friday at Patinoire Charlemagne arena in Lyon, France. Blair Jones scored the Comets' lone goal. New Hartford's Mike Zalewski and Cole Cassels had assists. Clay Witt stopped 32 of 34 shots for the Comets, who earned a 1-0 preseason win over the Crunch on Thursday in Lyon. Syracuse's Adam Wilcox had 24 saves. The teams traded goals in the first period. Syracuse's Tanner Richard scored an unassisted short-handed goal with about 5 minutes remaining the period. Utica answered 15 seconds later on Jones' goal. After a day off, the Comets play the Rouen Dragons at 12:30 p.m. Eastern on Sunday in Lyon before leaving for Utica. The Comets open the regular season on Saturday, Oct. 10, at Rochester. Also Friday, goaltender Richard Bachman and defenseman Taylor Fedun were assigned to the Comets. Bachman, who has spent time with the Edmonton Oilers and Dallas Stars during his career, was an AHL All-Star last season with the Oklahoma City Barons and faced the Comets in the Western Conference semifinals. Bachman, 28, had a 14-5-3 record with Oklahoma City last season, with a 2.38 goals-against average and 0.918 save percentage. He was 5-4 in the playoffs, with a 1.55 goals-against average and 0.953 save percentage. Fedun, 27, scored six goals and added 28 assists in 61 games for the Worcester Sharks last season. He had four assists in seven games for the San Jose Sharks. By Observer-Dispatch
